g7_i: School stopped functioning and is now closed (Examples include: Occupied by armed forces, Partially damaged, Totally damaged, Occupied by displaced persons, Lack of students)
g7_ii: Going or attending school is not safe (Examples include: it is unsafe to travel or go to school, Fear of recruitment in/on way to school, Fear of bombing, Fear of violence against children at school (corporal punishment, harassment by teachers and other students, bullying, etc.), Fear of abduction in/on way to school)
g7_iii: We cannot afford to pay for the school related expenses (Examples include: Cannot afford to pay for the school fees (e.g. school supplies, tuition, textbook, food, uniforms, etc.), Cannot afford to pay for transport)
g7_iv: We are not able to register or enrol our children in the school (Examples include: Recent or continuous movement to different locations, Newly arrived at location and have yet to enrol/register, Unable to enrol school due to discrimination, Poor performance/dismissed)
g7_v: Our children can’t physically go to the school (Examples include: Disability (of child), Traumatization (of child), School is too far away, No transport available to bring to school, No fuel available to bring to school, Child ill, disabled or unhealthy, Child is too young)
g7_vii: Lack of staff to run the school (Examples include: Lack of teachers, Lack of skilled/trained teachers, Lack of gender appropriate teachers/staff)
g7_viii: The school infrastructure is poor (Examples include: The schools building is in poor condition (e.g. lack of furniture, no electricity, water leaks, poor latrines, poor amenities, etc.), The WASH facilities are in poor conditions (latrines maintenance, smell, lightning, gender segregation, etc.)
g7_ix: The curriculum and teaching are not adapted for our children (Examples include: Curriculum is not appropriate; Language is not appropriate)
g7_x: Our children are busy working or supporting the household (Examples include: Children need to stay at home and assist the family with household chores or contribute to HH income, Early marriage)
g7_xi: Parental refusal to send children to school (Examples include: Customs/tradition, Don't believe schooling is necessary/do not consider education important, Missed too much school to make up, Children shouldn't get western education)
g7_xii: Lack of interest of children in education.

a26_ii: Area of origin was cleared of explosive hazards
a26_iii: Other family / community members have returned
a26_xv: Lack of safety and security for women and girls
a26_v: Basic services (water, electricity, health, education, etc.) are available in the area of origin
a26_vii: Necessary to secure personal housing, land and property
a26_ix: Limited livelihood opportunities in area of displacement
a26_x: Limited services in area of displacement
a26_xi: Do not feel safe in area of displacement

a26_xiii: Facing eviction in the area of displacement
a26_xiv: Forced to return by security actors or civilian authoritis
a15_i: Security concerns: Fear/trauma associated with returning to place of origin
a15_ii: Security concerns: Lack of security forces
a15_iii: Security concerns: Presence of explosive hazards (mines, bombs, IEDs)
a15_v: Lack of safety and security for women and girls
a15_xiv: Non-restoration of courts and/or civil registries in AoO
a15_vi: Movement restrictions (do not have proper paperwork to relocate)
a15_viii: No transportation available to return home
a15_ix: No financial means to return and restart
a15_x: Lack of livelihood/income generating activities in AoO
a15_xiii: House I own in AoO has been damaged/destroyed
a15_xii: House/land I own in AoO is currently occupied
a15_xi: Household assets in AoO have been damaged/stolen
a15_xvi: Basic services in the area of origin are not enough/available (electricity, water, health)
a15_xvii: Lack of education opportunities for children in the area of origin
a15_xviii: Immediate family and network will not return
a15_xix: Health condition does not allow me to leave the area of displacement
a15_xx: Children enrolled at school in the area of displacement
a15_xxi: Living conditions are better in the area of displacement
g67: % of IDP HHs not intending to return due to HLP issues (damage/destruction, secondary occupation or unresolved HLP ownership issues)
g73: % of IDP HHs not intending to return to their AoO due to explosive ordnance contamination

f7b: % of HH with access/knowledge of complaint mechanisms

d2_iv: Friends and family that have not been in the AoO

d5_x: Protection services (legal assistance; psycho-social support; GBV services; child protection services; explosive hazard risk education)
